entries.title: With Heightened Anxiety, Putin Prepares Russians for Long Fight Ahead
entries.description: The Russian leader has dropped the pretense that life goes on as normal despite the war, evident in the Kremlin’s quick acknowledgment of mass casualties inflicted by Ukraine last weekend.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Chaos in the U.S. House Speaker Race
entries.description: Also, China threatens countermeasures against travel restrictions.

entries.title: Prince Harry Says He Wants His Family Back in ITV, ’60 Minutes’ Interviews
entries.description: With Prince Harry’s new book, “Spare,” set to be released next week, Britain is gearing up for the release of revealing new interviews with the estranged royal.

entries.title: Activist Who Removed Banksy Mural in Ukraine Could Face Prison, Police Say
entries.description: The mural, showing a woman in a bathrobe wearing a gas mask and holding a fire extinguisher, was one of seven artworks painted by Banksy on war-ravaged buildings in and around Kyiv.

entries.title: Germany’s Inflation Rate Hit a High in 2022
entries.description: The pace of consumer price increases began easing late in the year, but the country’s annual rate of inflation set a new, post-Cold War record.

entries.title: In a Hospital Ward, the Wounds of a Failed Democracy Don’t Heal
entries.description: Tunisia’s road to democracy began with a self-immolation, and such cases have filled hospital burn wards ever since, as elected leaders failed to deliver on a promise of prosperity.

entries.title: Pele’s 24-Hour Funeral Attracted More Than 200,000 Mourners
entries.description: “This is no sacrifice,” said a man who had waited hours for a chance to attend Pelé’s 24-hour wake. Officials estimated 230,000 people filed through the stadium.

entries.title: France’s César Film Awards Bar Nominees Investigated on Sexual Violence Charges
entries.description: The César Academy’s decision is its latest effort to improve its image after years marked by abuse scandals.

entries.title: China Denounces Covid Testing Rules Imposed on Its Travelers
entries.description: A government spokeswoman said Beijing would consider reciprocal measures against countries that have sought to limit travelers arriving from China.

entries.title: Deadly strike on Russians in Ukraine exposes Moscow’s military failings.
Ukrainian Forces Grow More Adept at Defending Against Russian Drones
entries.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky said his military began the new year by putting up stiff resistance to Russia’s aerial attacks.

entries.title: HIMARS, a US-Made  Rocket System, Has Helped Give Ukraine Momentum
entries.description: Washington delivered the first batch of truck-mounted, multiple-rocket launchers, known as HIMARS, in June.

entries.title: Japan’s Business Owners Can’t Find Successors. This Man Is Giving His Away.
entries.description: An owner’s struggle in Japan’s northern dairy region illuminates one of the potentially devastating economic impacts of an aging society.

entries.title: Philippines: Christmas Floods Kill 51 and Strand Thousands
entries.description: Heavy rains on Christmas Day killed dozens of people and left thousands displaced. For a deeply Catholic nation, the timing heightened the sense of tragedy.

entries.title: Hard-Line Israeli Minister Visits Volatile Jerusalem Holy Site
entries.description: Itamar Ben-Gvir, the ultranationalist national security minister, toured the site just days after taking office, drawing a furious reaction from Palestinian leaders.

entries.title: Your Tuesday Briefing
entries.description: A major strike on Russian troops.

entries.title: In Romania, U.S. Troops Train Close to Russia’s War, in Signal to Moscow
entries.description: The deployment to a NATO country near the conflict in Ukraine is seen as a model of deterrence for a U.S. military that has recently stepped back from direct fighting.
